name: Code42
description: This app integrates with Code42 to execute various investigate, correct, generic, and containment actions

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using the supplied configuration
List all users
Unblock a device

device_id.description: ID of the device to unblock

actions.description: Block a device

device_id.description: ID of the device to block

actions.description: Deactivate a device

device_id.description: ID of the device to deactivate

actions.description: Activate a device

device_id.description: ID of the device to activate

actions.description: Deauthorize a device
actions.verbose: The current user is signed out of the Code42 app. The Code42 service stops backing up, and users cannot access the Code42 app to restore data or change settings without signing in again.

device_id.description: ID of the device to deauthorize

actions.description: Activate a user
actions.verbose: For the 'unblock_user' true value the user status will be changed to 'Activated' and 'Unblocked' and for the false value, the user status will only be changed to 'Activated'. Note: If the user is already active then it will ignore the 'unblock_user' parameter.

user.description: ID or Username of the user to activate

unblock_user.description: Unblock the user upon activation (Default: false)

actions.description: Deactivate a user
actions.verbose: For the 'block_user' true value the user status will be changed to 'Deactivated' and 'Blocked' and for the false value, the user status will only be changed to 'Deactivated'. Note: If the user is already deactive then it will ignore the 'block_user' parameter.

user.description: ID or Username of the user to deactivate

block_user.description: Block the user upon deactivation (Default: false)

actions.description: List all devices
Move a user to a specific organization
actions.verbose: Note: For the similar value of organization ID and name, organization ID will be considered upon name value. For instance, if the ID is 8062 and the organization name is also 8062 then action will be executed upon ID value.

organization.description: ID or Name of the organization

user.description: ID or Username of the user to move

example_values: User with ID 5 moved to organization with ID 234323 successfully

actions.description: List all organizations

example_values: This is a note about this org.

actions.description: Invoke an access lock on a specified device

device_id.description: ID of the device to lock

example_values: The Code42 server could not connect to the device. However, the device is flagged to be locked and will lock its volumes the next time it connects to the Code42 server.

actions.description: Deactivate an access lock on a specified device

device_id.description: ID of the device to unlock

actions.description: Get information for a specific device
actions.verbose: The query parameter allows flexible searching on computer name, osHostname, or guid. One parameter or the other must be used. If both the parameters are provided, device_id will be used to fetch the device details. Please provide at least one of the device_id or query parameter.

query.description: Query to match against computer name, osHostname, or guid

most_recent_only.description: Forces action to return one result, being the most recently connected device

actions.description: Push a restore on a device
actions.verbose: A user with the Push Restore role is required (or the SYSADMIN). Please provide at least one of the files or directories parameter.

target_node_guid.description: GUID of the target node (backup server)

restore_path.description: Path on accepting device to restore

files.description: Comma-separated list of file paths to restore

directories.description: Comma-separated list of directory paths to restore

actions.description: Check the status of a restore on a device

restore_id.description: Unique ID of the restore record

actions.description: Retrieves information for a specific user

user.description: ID or username of the user to retrieve information

actions.description: Hunt file on a forensic search
actions.verbose: The 'max_results' parameter is added to retrieve the provided number of max data. The default value is 100.

file_hash.description: MD5 hash of the file to search

actions.description: Run query on a forensic search
actions.verbose:
You can use wildcards (*,?) with parameters file_name and file_path. All query parameters are logical AND with each other. Parameters start_time and end_time are required when parameter query is not provided.
If query parameter is provided, other parameters will be ignored. Below is an example query for the query parameter:
{"groups": [{"filters": [{"operator": "IS", "term": "md5Checksum", "value": "db349b97c37d22f5ea1d1841e3c89eb4"}, {"operator": "IS", "term": "md5Checksum", "value": "84c82835a5d21bbcf75a61706d8ab549"}, {"operator": "IS", "term": "md5Checksum", "value": "f351e1fcca0c4ea05fc44d15a17f8b36"}, {"operator": "IS", "term": "md5Checksum", "value": "7bf2b57f2a205768755c07f238fb32cc"}], "filterClause": "OR"}, {"filters": [{"operator": "ON_OR_AFTER", "term": "eventTimestamp", "value": "2018-02-01T00:00:00.00Z"}, {"operator": "ON_OR_BEFORE", "term": "eventTimestamp", "value": "2018-02-07T00:00:00.00Z"}], "filterClause": "AND"}], "groupClause": "AND"}

Please refer to the Forensic file search API documentation for more details on query format. The 'max_results' parameter is added to retrieve the provided number of max data. The default value is 100.
Note: The value of 'pgNum' or 'pgSize' parameter provided in the JSON query parameter will be ignored by default.

file_hash.description: MD5 hash of the file to search

actions.description: Retrieve Code42 organization info using the v3_user_token for the given username & password
Add Departing Employee to Code42 Organization
actions.verbose: Action is divided into mainly two parts. First, the user profile will be created for the specified user and second is used to add the user profile to the departing employee list. Also, it will update/add the departure_notes and cloud_username details for the already added user profile.

departing_employee_url.description: Base URL for Departing Employee API

departing_user.description: Code42 username of the departing employee

example_values: Departing Employee Addition was Successful - Created Time: 2021-05-14T10:07:23.6156069Z

example_value: Departing Employee Addition was Successful - Created Time: 2021-05-20T10:29:03.7668618Z

actions.description: Remove departing employee from the departing employee list

departing_employee_url.description: Base URL for Departing Employee API

departing_user.description: Code42 username of the departing employee

example_values: Successfully removed a user from departing list
